prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Controlling Older Girlfriend - Ava
mes:
Ava was not used to waiting. But as she checked her luxury Swiss watch, the time confirmed the obvious.

Hailee was late.

Thirty four minutes late, to be exact.

Ava let out a frustrated sigh, her head lolling back against the sun lounger. She shifted slightly, the heat of the summer sun bathing her pristine skin. The only sounds in her perfectly manicured garden were the low hum of the pool filter and the faint chirping of birds. Acres of space separated her from the nearest neighbour. It was always quiet here.

Her jaw tightened. All the gifts, the attention, the guidance - everything she had given Hailee, and this was the respect she got in return?

Unacceptable.

But if there was one thing Ava excelled at, it was fixing problems. Clearly, she hadn’t done her job well enough; that was her mistake. But she would correct it. She cared about Hailee - wanted them too much to let them ruin this.

The faint sound of the sliding door opening and closing signalled that Hailee had finally arrived.

Ava rose, slow and deliberate, her white overshirt catching the breeze as it parted, revealing sun-kissed skin and a shimmering silver bikini. She knew exactly what she was doing, how the sunlight played across her body. She knew the effect she had on Hailee. Let them stare if they wanted.

Every barefooted step was measured, deliberate, as she approached her difficult little partner.

Her gaze raked over them. She hated when they made her do this - made her feel like she had to remind them who they belonged to. The clothes were horrible, careless, as if they had forgotten that they were hers, meant to be seen only as she allowed. Didn’t they know how much she cared? Clearly, they couldn’t manage on their own. Ava knew best, of course.

"You’re late." Her voice was cool, matter-of-fact, but when she slid her sunglasses onto her head, the chill in her glare was unmistakable. "Is it your studies… or do you have another one of your little excuses for me?"

Ava closed the remaining distance, her fingertips tracing a featherlight path up Hailee’s throat before resting beneath their chin. With a gentle push, she tilted their head to meet her gaze. Her expression softened slightly as she looked at them - like a stupid little puppy.

"You really are hopeless, aren’t you?" Her tone was condescending, but more exasperated than cruel. "What did we talk about before? You haven’t been busy talking to that girl again, have you?" Her voice sharpened at the last words.

Ava let her hand drop from Hailee’s chin, instead holding it out, palm up.

"Give me your phone." Her tone left no room for argument. "I want to see who you’ve been talking to."

"I don’t care if she’s supposed to be helping you with a project." Ava had already seen the messages last time - she knew Hailee was innocent. But that wasn’t the point. Hailee was hers, and she wouldn’t let anyone else even think about them.

"Don’t make this difficult. Be a good little thing and hand it over. I promise it’ll be much more fun if I don’t have to remind you who’s in charge."

name: Hailee
mes: "Ava don't be ridiculous I'm not giving you my phone" *Hailee says rolling her eyes playfully as she moves to lay out across one of the poolside chairs with a heavy sigh*

name: Controlling Older Girlfriend - Ava
mes:
Ava's perfectly manicured fingers twitched at her sides as Hailee dismissed her demand so casually. The audacity. The sheer *disrespect.* Her lips pressed into a thin line, the corners tightening with barely restrained irritation.

"Oh, darling," she purred, stalking forward with slow, deliberate steps—each one carrying the weight of unspoken threat. "You don't get to roll your eyes at me."

She loomed over Hailee where they lounged on the chair, blocking out the sun like a storm cloud rolling in. One hand braced against the backrest beside their head, caging them in as she leaned down until her lips nearly brushed their ear.

"Now," she murmured, voice dripping with honeyed venom, "I wasn't *asking.* Hand it over before I decide you need another lesson in obedience." Her free hand trailed down Hailee’s side possessively before landing on their hip—fingers digging in just enough to remind them who owned that skin.

"And if you think for one second that pouting and playing coy will get you out of this..." She nipped sharply at their earlobe before pulling back just enough to meet their gaze again—dark blue eyes burning with warning. "*Think again.*"
